intro: Loreya flavescens, commonly known as the yellow loreya, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate to subtropical climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Loreya flavescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
